attractions.name: Tivoli Gardens
attractions.description: Historic amusement park in the city center, featuring rides, concerts, and themed gardens.

attractions.name: Nyhavn
attractions.description: Picturesque 17th-century waterfront canal lined with colorful townhouses and restaurants.

attractions.name: Rosenborg Castle
attractions.description: Renaissance-era castle housing the Danish crown jewels and royal regalia, surrounded by King’s Garden.

attractions.name: Amalienborg Palace
attractions.description: The Danish royal family’s winter residence; watch the changing of the guard at noon.

attractions.name: The Little Mermaid
attractions.description: Iconic bronze statue inspired by Hans Christian Andersen’s fairy tale on the Langelinie promenade.

attractions.name: Round Tower
attractions.description: 17th-century astronomical observatory with a spiral ramp leading to panoramic city views.

attractions.name: Christiansborg Palace
attractions.description: Former royal residence, now housing the Danish Parliament, Supreme Court, and Prime Minister’s Office.

attractions.name: Designmuseum Denmark
attractions.description: Leading museum showcasing Danish design history from furniture to fashion and industrial design.

attractions.name: Botanical Garden
attractions.description: Historic gardens and greenhouses housing diverse plant collections in the heart of the city.

attractions.name: Torvehallerne Market
attractions.description: Popular food market featuring gourmet stalls, fresh produce, and international cuisines.

restaurants.name: Noma
restaurants.description: Pioneering restaurant in reinventing Nordic cuisine, multiple Michelin-starred.

restaurants.name: Geranium
restaurants.description: Three-Michelin-star restaurant with panoramic park views by chef Rasmus Kofoed.

restaurants.name: Amass
restaurants.description: Sustainable fine dining with ingredients from its own urban garden.

restaurants.name: Relae
restaurants.description: Innovative tasting menus focusing on organic, locally sourced produce.

restaurants.name: Kødbyens Fiskebar
restaurants.description: Popular seafood restaurant in the trendy Meatpacking District.

restaurants.name: Manfreds
restaurants.description: Cozy bistro known for its natural wines and vegetable-focused small plates.

restaurants.name: Bror
restaurants.description: Chef-driven restaurant offering innovative dishes in a minimalist space.

restaurants.name: Kiin Kiin
restaurants.description: Michelin-starred Thai restaurant blending authentic flavours with modern techniques.

restaurants.name: Palægade
restaurants.description: Modern take on Danish classics in a vibrant city center brasserie.

restaurants.name: Restaurant Radio
restaurants.description: Chef Christian Puglisi’s restaurant focusing on seasonal, locally sourced produce.

restaurants.name: Høst
restaurants.description: Stylish Nordic restaurant known for its warm interiors and hearty tasting menus.

restaurants.name: Gasoline Grill
restaurants.description: Popular burger joint known for its grass-fed beef burgers and fries.

restaurants.name: Aamanns 1921
restaurants.description: Expertly crafted smørrebrød using traditional techniques and high-quality ingredients.

price_range.name: Restaurant Schønnemann
price_range.description: Historic eatery famous for its open-face sandwiches and classic Danish fare since 1877.

price_range.name: Bæst
price_range.description: Artisanal pizza and charcuterie crafted with locally milled flour and organic ingredients.

bars.name: Ruby
bars.description: Meticulously crafted cocktails in a cozy townhouse setting.

bars.name: The Jane
bars.description: Mid-century lounge by evening, lively nightclub by midnight with vintage decor.

bars.name: Brønnum
bars.description: Six uniquely designed rooms serving diverse cocktails in a historic building.

bars.name: Mikkeller Bar
bars.description: Rotating selection of innovative brews from Copenhagen’s craft pioneer.

bars.name: Lidkoeb
bars.description: Three floors of whisky selections in a former pharmacy setting.

bars.name: Curfew
bars.description: 1920s-inspired ambiance with a focus on classic cocktails and attentive service.

bars.name: Taphouse
bars.description: Featuring one of Europe’s largest tap selections with 61 rotating brews.

bars.name: La Fontaine
bars.description: Copenhagen’s oldest jazz bar offering nightly live performances.

bars.name: Mojo Blues Bar
bars.description: Nightly live blues performances in an intimate setting.

bars.name: Warpigs Brewpub
bars.description: American-style BBQ paired with house-brewed craft beers in the Meatpacking District.

bars.name: Jolene Bar
bars.description: Eclectic cocktails in a bohemian setting popular with the creative crowd.

bars.name: Bakken
bars.description: Seasonal outdoor techno and dance events beneath a viaduct.

bars.name: SoHo
bars.description: Chic lounge bar offering cocktails and small plates in a stylish setting.

bars.name: Ved Stranden 10
bars.description: Intimate wine bar with a curated selection of natural wines and small bites.

bars.name: The Barking Dog
bars.description: Quirky cocktails inspired by canine themes in a playful atmosphere.

bars.name: Studio 61
bars.description: Artistic cocktail bar with rotating menu and local art displays.

bars.name: Zoo Bar
bars.description: Vintage ambiance offering classic cocktails and live piano music.

bars.name: H11
bars.description: Casual bar with multiple screens broadcasting sports and casual fare.

bars.name: K-Bar
bars.description: Welcoming LGBTQ+ venue with drag shows and themed nights.

bars.name: Fermentoren
bars.description: Industrial-chic bar focusing on local and international craft beers.

bars.name: Bryggeri Skovlyst
bars.description: Forest-set microbrewery producing organic ales and lagers.

bars.name: Kedelhuset
bars.description: Hidden bar beneath a boiler house featuring inventive cocktails.

attractions.name: Gamla Stan
attractions.description: Stockholm’s old town with cobblestone streets, colorful buildings, and the Royal Palace.

attractions.name: Vasa Museum
attractions.description: Home to the 17th-century warship Vasa, which sank on its maiden voyage and was salvaged centuries later.

attractions.name: Skansen
attractions.description: World’s first open-air museum showcasing Swedish history with live demonstrations and Nordic wildlife.

attractions.name: Royal Palace
attractions.description: One of Europe’s largest palaces with over 600 rooms and a daily guard ceremony.

attractions.name: Fotografiska
attractions.description: Contemporary photography museum with rotating exhibitions and waterfront views.

attractions.name: Moderna Museet
attractions.description: Sweden’s national museum of modern and contemporary art.

attractions.name: ABBA The Museum
attractions.description: Interactive exhibits celebrating ABBA’s music and legacy.

attractions.name: City Hall
attractions.description: Iconic building where the Nobel Prize banquet is held; offers guided tours and tower views.

attractions.name: Drottningholm Palace
attractions.description: UNESCO World Heritage site and best-preserved royal palace in Sweden.

attractions.name: Junibacken
attractions.description: Children’s museum celebrating Swedish storybook characters, especially Pippi Longstocking.

restaurants.name: Frantzén
restaurants.description: Sweden’s first three-Michelin-star restaurant offering a multi-sensory tasting menu.

restaurants.name: AIRA
restaurants.description: Seasonal Nordic flavours on Djurgården island with sweeping sea views.

restaurants.name: Ekstedt
restaurants.description: Michelin-starred restaurant using only open fire, wood, and smoke.

restaurants.name: Meatballs for the People
restaurants.description: Casual spot specializing in traditional and gourmet Swedish meatballs.

restaurants.name: Gastrologik
restaurants.description: Chef-driven tasting menus emphasizing local, seasonal produce.

restaurants.name: Oaxen Slip
restaurants.description: Rustic bistro offshoot of Oaxen Krog, serving classic dishes in a casual setting.

restaurants.name: Operakällaren
restaurants.description: Elegant dining under the Royal Swedish Opera with centuries-old traditions.

restaurants.name: Pelikan
restaurants.description: Historic beer hall serving traditional Swedish fare and local brews since 1733.

restaurants.name: Matbaren
restaurants.description: Michelin-starred counter dining from chef Mathias Dahlgren focusing on seasonal tasting plates.

restaurants.name: Rolfs Kök
restaurants.description: Bright, airy brasserie offering modern Swedish dishes in a relaxed space.

restaurants.name: Wedholms Fisk
restaurants.description: Renowned for fresh fish dishes and classic Swedish seafood recipes.

restaurants.name: Fem Små Hus
restaurants.description: Five historic cellar vaults serving traditional Swedish cuisine since the 17th century.

bars.name: Röda Huset
bars.description: Innovative cocktails highlighting Swedish ingredients in a stylish setting.

bars.name: A Bar Called Gemma
bars.description: Creative mixology in a warm, welcoming atmosphere.

bars.name: Häktet
bars.description: Set in a former prison, offering inventive cocktails and local craft beers.

bars.name: Omnipollos Hatt
bars.description: Renowned brewery bar with inventive beers and gourmet pizzas.

bars.name: Paradiso
bars.description: Tropical-inspired rum cocktails in a laid-back setting.

bars.name: Himlen
bars.description: Panoramic city views 104m up with refined cocktails and wines.

bars.name: Le Hibou
bars.description: Year-round rooftop with Parisian-inspired cocktails.

bars.name: Morfar Ginko
bars.description: Eclectic décor and vibrant crowd in Mariatorget.

bars.name: Kvarnen
bars.description: Established 1908, serving classic Swedish beers and fare.

bars.name: Tjoget
bars.description: Innovative cocktails, Mediterranean-inspired small plates, and a wine bodega.

bars.name: Pharmarium
bars.description: Herbaceous cocktails in a historic Gamla Stan apothecary setting.

bars.name: Tak Bar
bars.description: Stylish rooftop lounge with DJs and panoramic city views.

bars.name: The Lobby
bars.description: Affordable local beers and relaxed vibe.

bars.name: Mosebacke Etablissement
bars.description: Summer rooftop with a stage for live music and theatre.

bars.name: Ström Terrassen
bars.description: Floating bar on the water, open in summer months.

bars.name: Icebar Stockholm
bars.description: World’s first permanent bar made of ice—everyone gets thermal capes.

bars.name: Marie Laveau
bars.description: Two-story bar with cocktails downstairs and club upstairs.

bars.name: Morfar Ginko
bars.description: Eclectic décor and vibrant crowd in Mariatorget.

bars.name: Akkurat
bars.description: One of Europe’s best beer bars with 30+ taps and extensive bottled selection.

bars.name: Oliver Twist
bars.description: Intimate bar with 500+ whiskies and a cozy atmosphere.

bars.name: Mälarpaviljongen
bars.description: Open-air summer bar on the waterfront serving drinks and casual bites.

bars.name: Ling Long
